c74object.name: iruser~
c74object.digest: Create an IR with a specified frequency response and a given output phase
c74object.description: iruser~ allows the user to create IRs by numerically specifiying a given amplitude response, and specifying a given output phase.

outlet.digest: Bang on completion of called process

method.name: make
method.description:
Syntax: make <symbol: out_buffer_name> [<int: fft_size>] [<int/float: sample_rate>]
Make an IR by specifiying a given amplitude response and a given output phase.
make args: output buffer / [FFT Size = 4096] / [sample rate = global sr]

attribute.name: phase
attribute.description:
Specifies the phase of the output. The phase may either be specified as a float value between 0 and 1 (where 0 is minimum phase, 0.5 is linear phase and 1 is maximum phase), or using any of the following symbols:
min / minimum: Minimum Phase
lin / linear: Linear Phase
max / maximum: Maximum Phase
units: float or symbol, default: 0 / minimum, range: 0..1 or min/lin/max

attribute.name: resize
attribute.description:
If on, the buffer~ will resize to the necessary size before write. Resizing erases all contents of the buffer~.
Otherwise, output will ONLY happen if there is enough room to write the entire output, leaving the latter contents of the buffer~ and other buffer~ channels unaffected.
units: flag, default: 1, range: 0/1

attribute.name: response
attribute.description: The frequency response is specified as a list of frequency / dB pairs via the response attribute. This is the same format as the output of irplapprox~. It is also possible to specifiy a single dB value (creating a single sample spike).

attribute.name: writechan
attribute.description:
Sets the channel number for buffer~ writing (1-4). If the specified channel does not exist the value is wrapped within the existing number of channels (so 3 will write to channel 1 of a two-channel buffer~, 4 to channel 2).
units: int, default: 1, range: 1..4

c74object.discussion: iruser~ allows the user to create IRs by numerically specifiying a given amplitude response, and specifying a given output phase. The response specification format matches that of deconvolution filter specifiers in the HIRT, and also the output of the irplapprox~ object.
